sentences.en: A solvent for the material to be deposited is needed in LPE.
sentences.cn: 在LPE法中,需要有待淀积材料的溶剂.

sentences.en: Different proprietary organic - solvent preservatives often contain the same toxicants.
sentences.cn: 不同专利的有机溶剂防腐剂往往含有相同的毒性剂.

sentences.en: For protein crystallization, the main impact of precipitant is on the solvent.
sentences.cn: 对于蛋白质的结晶，沉淀剂主要在溶剂上产生作用。

sentences.en: Gasoline is a solvent liquid that removes grease spats.
sentences.cn: 汽油是一种能脱去油迹的有溶解能力的液体.

sentences.en: Gasoline is a solvent liquid which removes grease spots.
sentences.cn: 汽油是一种能去掉油污的有溶解力的液体.

sentences.en: If water is the solvent, it is called hydration.
sentences.cn: 如果以水作溶剂, 它便称为水合.

sentences.en: It is difficult to define the detection limits obtained by chelation - solvent extraction.
sentences.cn: 确定螯合 -- 溶剂萃取法所得到的检测限颇为困难.

sentences.en: Lead is more solvent in acidic water.
sentences.cn: 铅在酸性水中更易溶解。

sentences.en: Smoke is almost as great a solvent as divorce.
sentences.cn: 吸烟和离婚已变成两大消溶剂.

sentences.en: The waxes are classed as alcohol or organic solvent extracted materials.
sentences.cn: 这种蜡质属于乙醇有机溶剂的萃取物.

sentences.en: There the solvent evaporates and the solute is deposited.
sentences.cn: 溶剂在这里蒸发,溶质析出.

sentences.en: They're going to have to show that the company is now solvent.
sentences.cn: 他们将不得不证明公司现在是具备偿债能力的。

sentences.en: To be economical these processes will require efficient solvent recovery operations.
sentences.cn: 若要经济,就要有有效的溶剂回收工序.

sentences.en: Water is a very good solvent for ionic species.
sentences.cn: 水对各种离子是非常好的溶剂.

sentences.en: We must cut back on expenditure in order to remain solvent.
sentences.cn: 我们应减少开支,以备急用.

words.tran_cn: 可以解决的；可以解的；可溶的
[化学] 溶质；[化学] 溶解物
解决方案；溶液；溶解；解答
[数] 可解性；解决之可能性；溶解度
溶剂化物；[化学] 溶剂合物
[化学] 溶解；[化学] 溶剂化作用；溶化
解决者；[计] 解算机；[数] 求解程序
有偿付能力的；[化学]有溶解力的

phrases.tran_cn: 溶剂清洗；溶液净化；用溶剂清洁
溶剂抽提物；溶剂提取物

trans.tran_cn: 有溶解能力的，可溶解的，有清还债务能力的，起瓦解作用的
trans.tran_en: having enough money to pay your debts

trans.tran_cn: [化]溶剂，溶媒，解释，说明，解决方法，使瓦解的东西
trans.tran_en: a chemical that is used to  dissolve  another substance
